channel.title: Oliver Wipfli on MapLibre
channel.description: Recent content in Oliver Wipfli on MapLibre

item.title: Second Call for Bounties
item.description: We are happy to invite you to a second round of voting on Bounty directions. Please let us know which features would be helpful for you and upvote existing suggestions.

item.title: MapLibre Newsletter February 2023
item.description: MapLibre Newsletter - February 2023 General We have successfully registered the MapLibre trademark in the US and in the EU . Open Source Collective, our fiscal host, holds the MapLibre trademarks.

item.title: MapLibre User Group Japan
item.description: If you speak Japanese and you are interested in map rendering, have a look at the newly created MapLibre User Group Japan. Official Website: https://bit.ly/mug--jp Twitter Space: https://twitter.com/i/spaces/1OyKAVvlgvbGb Yasunori Kirimoto and Kanahiro Iguchi who are both MapLibre Voting Members are organizing the User Group.

item.title: Bounty Directions
item.description: The MapLibre Bounty Program will support the following cross-project directions: Terrain3D, globe view, documentation, performance, Brahmic/Indic scripts, MapLibre Innovation Lab. We invited the broader community to give feedback and share ideas for cross-project directions in a discussion group on GitHub .

item.title: Harel Mazor starts as Maintainer Web
item.description: We are happy to share that we were able to contract Harel Mazor, the long-time lead-maintainer of MapLibre GL JS, for the Maintainer Web role. Please give him a warm welcome!

item.title: Ovidiu Voda starts as Maintainer Native
item.description: With Ovidiu Voda starting today, we are proud to now have two people working as Maintainers on MapLibre GL Native. Please give Ovi a warm welcome! Ovi is going to work together with Bart Louwers on Native and he is looking forward to meeting everyone involved in the project.

item.title: Grab Talk Khmer
item.description: Alan Wei Chen from GrabMaps is giving a talk about how Grab renders text labels in the Khmer language using FreeType and HarfBuzz in the next MapLibre Eastern Call. Feel free to join the presentation!

item.title: Steering Committee Notes January
item.description: We had our first monthly meeting of 2023. You find the meeting notes here: #187 Feel free to join our next monthly meeting on Wednesday, Feb 8th, 2023. The technical steering committee meetings are open to everyone!

item.title: Bart Louwers starts as Maintainer Native
item.description: Today, Bart Louwers is starting to work with MapLibre in the Maintainer Native role. Let’s give him a warm welcome! Bart is excited to meet the people involved in the project and learn more about the codebase and the community behind it.

item.title: Call for BountiesðŸ’°
item.description: If you have ideas for new features which you would love to see from MapLibre, you can now share your idea and tell us that we should allocate Bounties for it.

item.title: Steering Committee Notes December
item.description: Yesterday, we had a first MapLibre Eastern Call at 9 AM CET, the native technical steering committee meeting at 7 PM CET, and the web technical steering committee meeting at 8 PM CET.

item.title: Metal Announcement
item.description: MapLibre GL Native is planning for modularization and migration to Metal, Apple’s graphics framework, for rendering on iOS mobile devices. A design proposal for the modularization of the map rendering architecture can be found at #547 .

item.title: Work on Open-Source
item.description: We thank all our sponsors for their generous financial support and assistance in building the MapLibre Organization. We were successful in securing initial funding and would now like to pay people from the community for coordination, maintenance, and development work.

item.title: Governing Board Election and Charter Approval
item.description: On Thursday, Aug 25th, 2022, the MapLibre Voting Members elected for the first time a Governing Board and they approved the MapLibre Charter. We thank all the candidates and Voting Members for participating in this process!

item.title: Meta becomes a MapLibre Sponsor
item.description: We are pleased to announce that Meta now is a sponsor of the MapLibre Organization. Thanks for your generous help and for all the trust you put in us! Meta has been involved in the MapLibre Organization since the very beginning, helped setting up the initial fork, and provided guidance on non-trivial questions around licensing.

item.title: AWS becomes a MapLibre Platinum Sponsor
item.description: We are pleased to announce the Amazon Web Services (AWS) support for the MapLibre Organization as a Platinum Sponsor. Thanks for your generous support and for all the trust you put in us!

item.title: Steering Committee Notes May
item.description: Steering committee meeting notes available #69 .

item.title: MIERUNE Inc. supports MapLibre with USD 10'000
item.description: Recently, MIERUNE Inc. from Japan decided to support MapLibre financially with a generous donation of USD 10'000, see https://opencollective.com/maplibre . This is the largest ammount that MapLibre has received to date.

item.title: Steering Committee Notes June
item.description: Steering committee meeting notes available #34 .

item.title: Terrain3D
item.description: The Terrain3D #1022 of Max Demmelbauer from Toursprung was merged into main. Thanks for all the hard work! You can now try out the 3D feature yourself with the pre-release version MapLibre GL JS v2.

item.title: Steering Committee Notes May
item.description: Steering committee meeting notes available #28 . Terrain3D can be merged now :) Thanks Max and everyone at Toursprung for their contributions!

item.title: Steering Committee Notes April
item.description: Steering committee meeting notes available #15 . Terrain 3D might be a matter of days or weeks only until we can merge and make a pre-release.

item.title: Steering Committee Notes March
item.description: Steering committee meeting notes available #14 .

item.title: Steering Committee Notes February
item.description: Steering committee meeting notes available #9 . Terrain 3D is coming soon. Thanks Max and everyone at Toursprung for contributing this new feature!

item.title: Steering Committee Notes November
item.description: Steering committee meeting notes available #3 .

item.title: Steering Committee Notes October
